mods.abstract: Photograph showing corn samples of multi-colored varieties and different sizes.
mods.note: The following article explains how corn exhibits are created and judged at the State Fair. Dodson, W.R. & Roy, V.L. (1909, August) Corn. Louisiana Bulletin, No. 118, pp. 15-16. Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://books.google.com/books?id=8e02AQAAIAAJ&pg=RA1-PA121&lpg=RA1-PA121&dq=1909+Louisiana+State+Fair+Premium+Corn+winner&source=bl&ots=-uSG1vQsdi&sig=4_-b6BFBW0kw0wlkAjhZh6W5U28&hl=en&sa=X&ei=LkLEU9mRBLSJ8gH_mYGIBQ&ved=0CDMQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=1909%20Louisiana%20State%20Fair%20Premium%20Corn%20winner&f=false; Advertisement for corn submissions to the Louisiana State Fair. Corn! Corn! Corn! (1913, September 23) The Lafayette advertiser, Vol.64 (No. 18), p.3. Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn86079068/1913-09-23/ed-1/seq-3/
